ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: My child felt scared that he/she might have trouble breathing because of asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: My child's chest felt tight because of asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: My child felt wheezy because of his/ her asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: My child had trouble breathing because of his/ her asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: My child had trouble sleeping at night because of asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: It was hard for my child to play sports or exercise because of asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: It was hard for my child to take a deep breath because of asthma
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always

ElementDescription: My child's asthma bothered him/ her
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Almost Never; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often; 5= Almost Always
